item.title: Cristy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself to be a fool." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cristy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Be not afraid of greatness. Some are born great, some achieve greatness, and others have greatness thrust upon them." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cristy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cristy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "If music be the food of love, play on, Give me excess of it; that surfeiting, The appetite may sicken, and so die." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cristy add a quote by William Shakespeare
Cristy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cristy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Let me not to the marriage of true minds Admit impediments. Love is not love Which alters when it alteration finds, Or bends with the remover to remove. O no, it is an ever-fixed mark That looks on tempests and is never shaken; It is the star to every wand'ring barque, Whose worth's unknown, although his height be taken. Love's not Time's fool, though rosy lips and cheeks Within his bending sickle's compass come; Love alters not with his brief hours and weeks, But bears it out even to the edge of doom. If this be error and upon me proved, I never writ, nor no man ever loved." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cristy add a quote by William Shakespeare
Cristy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "When he shall die, Take him and cut him out in little stars, And he will make the face of heaven so fine That all the world will be in love with night And pay no worship to the garish sun." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cristy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Lord, what fools these mortals be!" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Henry van Dyke
item.description: "Time is Too Slow for those who Wait, Too Swift for those who Fear, Too Long for those who Grieve, Too Short for those who Rejoice; But for those who Love, Time is not." -- Henry van Dyke

item.title: Cristy add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "Presume not that I am the thing I was." -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description:
"The Road Not Taken
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same,
And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back.
I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I— I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "No tears in the writer, no tears in the reader. No surprise in the writer, no surprise in the reader." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "These woods are lovely, dark and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no one’s definition of your life; define yourself." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "There is one thing more exasperating than a wife who can cook and won't, and that's a wife who can't cook and will." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "The best way out is always through." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Reality continues to ruin my life." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Sometimes when I'm talking, my words can't keep up with my thoughts. I wonder why we think faster than we speak. Probably so we can think twice." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Bill Watterson
Cristy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "You can't just turn on creativity like a faucet. You have to be in the right mood. What mood is that? Last-minute panic." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "We're so busy watching out for what's just ahead of us that we don't take time to enjoy where we are." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Hobbes: Jump! Jump! Jump! I win! Calvin: You win? Aaugghh! You won last time! I hate it when you win! Aarrggh! Mff! Gnnk! I hate this game! I hate the whole world! Aghhh! What a stupid game! You must have cheated! You must have used some sneaky, underhanded mindmeld to make me lose! I hate you! I didn't want to play this idiotic game in the first place! I knew you'd cheat! I knew you'd win! Oh! Oh! Aarg! [Calvin runs in circles around Hobbes screaming "Aaaaaaaaaaaa", then falls over.] Hobbes: Look, it's just a game. Calvin: I know! You should see me when I lose in real life!" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "I'm killing time while I wait for life to shower me with meaning and happiness." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Hobbes: Do you think there's a God? Calvin: Well, somebody's out to get me!" -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "There's never enough time to do all the nothing you want." -- Bill Watterson

item.title: Cristy add a quote by Bill Watterson
item.description: "Calvin: Look, a dead bird! Hobbes: It must've hit a window. Calvin: Isn't it beautiful? It's so delicate. Sighhh... once it's too late, you appreciate what a miracle life is. You realize that nature is ruthless and our existence is very fragile, temporary, and precious. But to go on with your daily affairs, you can't really think about that...which is probably why everyone takes the world for granted and why we act so thoughtlessly. It's very confusing. I suppose it will all make sense when we grow up. Hobbes: No doubt." -- Bill Watterson
